title: Washington state space economy more than doubles
summary: Washington state’s space economy is booming.

title: U.S. and international partners to share launch cost of new communications satellite
summary: U.S. officials are in talks with international users of the Wideband Global Satcom (WGS) communications satellites about a cost-sharing agreement to fund the launch of the new WGS-11+.

title: U.S. and allies to strengthen cooperation in space
summary: The Defense Department announced Feb. 22 that the United States, Australia, Canada, France, Germany, New Zealand, and the United Kingdom have signed a joint vision document that calls for greater cooperation to prevent conflicts in space.

title: NASA to Provide Media Update on Artemis I Moon Mission
summary: NASA will host a media teleconference at 1:30 p.m. EST on Thursday, Feb. 24, to provide an update on progress toward the launch of the agency’s uncrewed Artemis I mission.

title: With eyes on reuse, Relativity plans rapid transition to Terran R engines
summary: "Yeah, we are definitely launching this year."

title: CAPSTONE lunar cubesat mission to launch this spring
summary: A cubesat mission to test a lunar orbit critical to NASA’s Artemis program is in the final stages of preparations for a launch this spring.

title: SpaceX to send retired Starship to local Texas airport, says Elon Musk
summary: In a brief Twitter exchange, the Brownsville/South Padre Island International Airport (BRO) appears to have talked SpaceX CEO Elon Musk into turning...

title: Virgin Galactic on schedule to start commercial human suborbital flights this year
summary: Virgin Galactic executives said Feb. 22 that they remain on schedule to begin commercial human suborbital missions before the end of the year but acknowledged it will take several years for the company to become profitable.

title: SpaceX launches Starlink satellites to higher orbit
summary: SpaceX launched a set of Starlink satellites Feb. 21 after more than three-fourths of the satellites from the previous launch were lost because of a solar storm.

title: Northrop Grumman delivers cargo and new reboost capability to space station
summary: A commercial Cygnus cargo freighter from Northrop Grumman arrived at the International Space Station Monday, delivering more than 8,000 pounds of supplies and a new U.S. capability to reboost the altitude of the complex independent of Russian rocket thrusters.
